availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Seberry Cook Sr. (Grant County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Grant County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Evalina Kinman Cook in Grant County, Kentucky, in November 1836. Father of Levi Cook, Eveline Cook, John M. Cook, Malinda Cook, William S. Cook Jr., and Henry S. Cook. Married to Margaret Smith Cook in Owen County, Kentucky, in November 1857. Farmer in Grant County in 1850. Farmer in Grant County in 1860. Enrolled in the 11th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private on July 16, 1862. Rejected for service.

ab.bibl:

Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Grant County Marriages, 000266220
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File 22153.
